Example

Suppose that we have a triangle \(ABC\) as above. Let angle \(A = 48^\circ\), angle \(C = 78^\circ\) and the length of side \(AB\) be \(23\)cm. Hence find the length of side \(BC\).

Solution

Substituting the values into the sine rule and noting that \(BC = a\) we have that \[ \frac{a}{\sin A} = \frac{23}{\sin 37^\circ} \implies \frac{a}{\sin 48^\circ} = \frac{23}{\sin 37^\circ}. \] Hence, we can rearrange this expression so that we get the length \(a\); \[ a = \sin 48^\circ \times \left(\frac{23}{\sin 37^\circ}\right) \approx 28.4\: cm \]
